wikipedia_page.main: Stephen McKenna is an ex professional Scottish association football defensive midfielder. He won the Scottish Challenge Cup in 2008 with Airdrie United and in 2013 with Queen of the South also winning a divisional title with the Queen's that season. McKenna retired from senior football aged 29 to focus on a career outside the game.

response: On 7 December 2009, Dumfries club Queen of the South announced Andrews had signed on a one-month loan as cover for the suspended David Lilley and Stephen McKenna.'New signing Marvin Andrews joins Queens Manager Gordon Chisholm gave Andrews his Queens debut on 12 December in the 2–1 win away to Morton.Morton 1 – 2 Queen of the South With bad weather causing a series of fixture postponements at Palmerston Park, Andrews played only one other game for Queens during the loan period, in the 2–2 draw away at Partick Thistle.  However Andrews returned to QoS by signing a six-month deal on 29 January 2010."Latest 'ins and outs'" www.qosfc.com "World Cup Doonhamers" on www.qosfc.com Andrews was released by Queens at the end of the 2009–10 season.

Morton sign St Johnstone striker Andy Jackson on a free transfer, with Queen of the South midfielder Stephen McKenna expected to sign shortly. McKenna however rejected a move to Cappielow, preferring to stay at the Doonhamers.
